author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Sets the labels on a disk.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-disk-labels

commands.description: Retrieves the specified zone-specific Operations resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-zone-operation

commands.description: Changes the machine type for a stopped instance to the machine type specified in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-instance-machine-type

commands.description: Retrieves the list of Snapshot resources contained within the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-snapshots

commands.description: Retrieves the list of region resources available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-regions

commands.description: Retrieves a list of global addresses.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-global-addresses

commands.description: Creates a network in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-network

commands.description: Deletes the specified Snapshot resource. Keep in mind that deleting a single snapshot might not necessarily delete all the data on that snapshot. If any data on the snapshot that is marked for deletion is needed for subsequent snapshots, the data will be moved to the next corresponding snapshot.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-snapshot

commands.description: Deletes the specified address resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-global-address

commands.description: Wait for a global operation to complete ,NOTE this command will occupy a system resource
commands.name: gcp-compute-wait-for-global-operation

commands.description: Retrieves an aggregated list of addresses.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-addresses

commands.description: Adds a peering to the specified network.
commands.name: gcp-compute-networks-add-peering

commands.description: Sets the named ports for the specified instance group.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-group-instance-named-ports

commands.description: Returns the specified disk type. Gets a list of available disk types by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-disk-type

commands.description: Wait for a region operation to complete ,NOTE this command will occupy a system resource
commands.name: gcp-compute-wait-for-region-operation

commands.description: Retrieves the list of instances contained within the specified zone.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-instances

commands.description: Returns the specified network.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-network

commands.description: Retrieves a list of machine types available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-machine-types

commands.description: Deletes the specified address resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-address

commands.description: Returns the specified address resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-address

commands.description: Adds a list of instances to the specified instance group. All of the instances in the instance group must be in the same network/subnetwork. Read Adding instances for more information.
commands.name: gcp-compute-instance-groups-add-instances

commands.description: Deletes the specified persistent disk. Deleting a disk removes its data permanently and is irreversible. However, deleting a disk does not delete any snapshots previously made from the disk. You must separately delete snapshots.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-disk

commands.description: Removes one or more instances from the specified instance group, but does not delete those instances.  If the group is part of a backend service that has enabled connection draining, it can take up to 60 seconds after the connection draining duration before the VM instance is removed or deleted.
commands.name: gcp-compute-instance-groups-remove-instances

commands.description: Sets labels on an instance. To learn more about labels, read the Labeling Resources documentation.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-instance-labels

commands.description: Stops a running instance, shutting it down cleanly, and allows you to restart the instance at a later time. Stopped instances do not incur VM usage charges while they are stopped. However, resources that the VM is using, such as persistent disks and static IP addresses, will continue to be charged until they are deleted. For more information, see Stopping an instance.
commands.name: gcp-compute-stop-instance

commands.description: Add or update project wide metadata.
commands.name: gcp-compute-project-info-add-metadata

commands.description: Creates a persistent disk in the specified project using the data in the request. You can create a disk with a sourceImage, a sourceSnapshot, or create an empty 500 GB data disk by omitting all properties. You can also create a disk that is larger than the default size by specifying the sizeGb property.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-disk

commands.description: Creates a snapshot of a specified persistent disk.
commands.name: gcp-compute-create-disk-snapshot

commands.description: Retrieves the list of instance groups that are located in the specified project and zone.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-instance-groups

commands.description: Retrieves a list of Operation resources contained within the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-global-operation

commands.description: Returns the specified Zone resource. Gets a list of available zones by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-zone

commands.description: Returns the specified image. Gets a list of available images by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-image

commands.description: Creates an instance resource in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-instance

commands.description: Returns the specified Snapshot resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-snapshot

commands.description: Retrieves instance information based on public IP in your project across all regions and zones.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-instances-by-ip

commands.description: Deletes the specified Instance resource. For more information, see Stopping or Deleting an Instance.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-instance

commands.description: Retrieves a list of Operation resources contained within the specified zone.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-zone-operation

commands.description: Retrieves an aggregated list of disk types.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-disk-types

commands.description: Deletes the specified image.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-image

commands.description: Retrieves the list of Zone resources available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-zones

commands.description: Retrieves a list of disk types available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-disk-types

commands.description: Retrieves an aggregated list of machine types.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-machine-types

commands.description: Removes a peering from the specified network.
commands.name: gcp-compute-networks-remove-peering

commands.description: Deletes the specified zone-specific Operations resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-zone-operation

commands.description: Retrieves a list of addresses contained within the specified region.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-addresses

commands.description: Deletes the specified network.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-network

commands.description: Retrieves aggregated list of all of the instances in your project across all regions and zones.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-instances

commands.description: Returns the specified instance group. Gets a list of available instance groups by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-instance-group

commands.description: Retrieves the list of instance groups and sorts them by zone.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-instance-groups

commands.description: Creates an image in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-image

commands.description: Returns the specified Region resource. Gets a list of available regions by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-region

commands.description: Returns a specified persistent disk. Gets a list of available persistent disks by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-disk

commands.description: Creates an address resource in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-global-address

commands.description: Retrieves the list of networks available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-networks

commands.description: Lists the instances in the specified instance group.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-instance-group-instances

commands.description: Sets metadata for the specified instance to the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-instance-metadata

commands.description: Starts an instance that was stopped using the instances().stop method. For more information, see Restart an instance.
commands.name: gcp-compute-start-instance

commands.description: Creates an instance group in the specified project using the parameters that are included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-instance-group

commands.description: Sets the labels on an image.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-image-labels

commands.description: Add network tag for the specified instance.
commands.name: gcp-compute-add-network-tag

commands.description: Creates an address resource in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-address

commands.description: Creates a firewall rule in the specified project using the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-insert-firewall

commands.description: Returns the specified Instance resource. Gets a list of available instances by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-instance

commands.description: Returns the latest image that is part of an image family and is not deprecated.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-image-from-family

commands.description: Resizes the specified persistent disk. You can only increase the size of the disk.
commands.name: gcp-compute-resize-disk

commands.description: Deletes the specified address resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-global-address

commands.description: Wait for a zone operation to complete ,NOTE this command will occupy a system resource
commands.name: gcp-compute-wait-for-zone-operation

commands.description: Retrieves the list of firewall rules available to the specified project.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-firewall

commands.description: Deletes the specified firewall.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-firewall

commands.description: Retrieves the specified region-specific Operations resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-region-operation

commands.description: Returns the specified machine type. Gets a list of available machine types by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-machine-type

commands.description: Retrieves an aggregated list of persistent disks.
commands.name: gcp-compute-aggregated-list-disks

commands.description: Deletes the specified region-specific Operations resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-region-operation

commands.description: Returns the specified firewall.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-firewall

commands.description: Retrieves the list of custom images available to the specified project. Custom images are images you create that belong to your project. This method does not get any images that belong to other projects, including publicly-available images, like Debian 8. If you want to get a list of publicly-available images, use this method to make a request to the respective image project, such as debian-cloud or windows-cloud.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-images

commands.description: Retrieves a list of persistent disks contained within the specified zone.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-disks

commands.description: Deletes the specified instance group. The instances in the group are not deleted. Note that instance group must not belong to a backend service. Read Deleting an instance group for more information.  HTTP
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-instance-group

commands.description: Deletes the specified Operations resource.
commands.name: gcp-compute-delete-global-operation

commands.description: Retrieves the specified Operations resource. Gets a list of operations by making a list() request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-get-global-operation

commands.description: Updates the specified firewall rule with the data included in the request.
commands.name: gcp-compute-patch-firewall

commands.description: Performs a reset on the instance. This is a hard reset the VM does not do a graceful shutdown. For more information, see Resetting an instance.
commands.name: gcp-compute-reset-instance

commands.description: Sets the labels on a snapshot.
commands.name: gcp-compute-set-snapshot-labels

commands.description: Retrieves a list of Operation resources contained within the specified region.
commands.name: gcp-compute-list-region-operation

integration.description: Google Compute Engine delivers virtual machines running in Google's innovative data centers and worldwide fiber network. Compute Engine's tooling and workflow support enable scaling from single instances to global, load-balanced cloud computing.
integration.name: Google Cloud Compute

playbook.description: Set a list of IP addresses in GCP firewall.
playbook.name: IP Whitelist - GCP Firewall

description: Google Compute Engine delivers virtual machines running in Google's innovative data centers and worldwide fiber network. Compute Engine's tooling and workflow support enable scaling from single instances to global, load-balanced cloud computing.
name: Google Cloud Compute
